item.title: Paint With Fire Using This Virtual Reality App
item.description:
Paint With Fire Using This Virtual Reality App

Vocativ uses intelligent technology, smart journalists and the wisdom of the crowd to find story leads and angles no other news organization can.

item.title: New SpaceX landing photos make you feel like the rocket is coming down on top of you
item.description:
New SpaceX landing photos make you feel like the rocket is coming down on top of you

Up until now, we've really only seen SpaceX's rocket landing in the middle of the ocean from afar. Chase planes near the drone ship provided a spectacular view of the milestone event, but now, S...

item.title: Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry
item.description:
Why Tesla Will Destroy the Automobile Industry

If there's an example of a company about to disruptively innovate an entire industry, it's Tesla. Partly, this is because of raw technology--Tesla's is clearly superior to that of its competitors. Partly, it's because Tesla has a more efficient business model. As Slate recently pointed out, Tesla bypasses value-subtracting dealer franchises and universally disliked car salespeople.

item.title: 'Light field' camera maker Lytro announces professional VR video rig
item.description:
'Light field' camera maker Lytro announces professional VR video rig

Camera maker Lytro drew our attention three years ago with what it called "light field" photography. Instead of focusing at a specific depth, its camera would capture everything in range of its finder, so you could do things like pick a focus after taking the picture.

item.title: Thinking inside the box: Prepd reinvents the lunchbox.
item.description:
Thinking inside the box: Prepd reinvents the lunchbox.

Packing attention to detail, intelligent design and delicious food into lunchtime is San Francisco-based team Prepd, founded by Chris Place and Will Matters. Their creation, 'Prepd Pack', is a modern take on the classic lunchbox, launched in January 2016 via a Kickstarter campaign that raised over $1 million.
